intro: Eriochloa trichopus, commonly known as hairy panicgrass, is a perennial grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes and along waterways, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Eriochloa trichopus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wetland organisms.
